ElementDescription: The NDAR Global Unique Identifier (GUID) for research subject
Subject ID how it's defined in lab/project
Date on which the interview/genetic test/sampling/imaging/biospecimen was completed. MM/DD/YYYY
Age in months at the time of the interview/test/sampling/imaging.
Notes: Age is rounded to chronological month. If the research participant is 15-days-old at time of interview, the appropriate value would be 0 months. If the participant is 16-days-old, the value would be 1 month.

ElementDescription: Sex of subject at birth
Notes: M = Male; F = Female; O=Other; NR = Not reported

ElementDescription: Assessment type
Notes: 1=TADS GATE A; 2=TADS GATE B; 3 = TADS Gate C; 4 = TADS Week 6; 5 = TADS Week 12; 6 = TADS Week 18; 7 = TADS Week 24; 8 = TADS Week 30; 9 = TADS Week 36; 10 = TADS F/U Mo 3; 11 = TADS F/U Mo 6; 12 = TADS F/U Mo 9; 13 = TADS F/U Mo 12; 14 = SOFTAD month 6; 15 = SOFTAD month 12; 16 = SOFTAD month 18; 17 = SOFTAD month 24; 18 = SOFTAD month 30; 19 = SOFTAD month 36; 20 = SOFTAD month 42

ElementDescription: Study stage
Notes: 0 = Pre-Randomization (TADS) 1 = Stage 1 (TADS) 2 = Stage 2 (TADS) 3 = Stage 3 (TADS) 4 = Stage 4 (TADS) 5 = Stage 5 (SOFTAD); 51=Treatmentas Usual; 52=Screening Alone; 53=Intervention; 67=Unknown; -888=Not Applicable; -999=Missing;

ElementDescription: Question 1. In the past three months, how often have you used alcohol or other drugs at home? (Imputed Version). Imputation Rule: if less than 4 of PESQ1_U-PESQ8_U, PESQ10_U- PESQ14_U, PESQ16_U-PESQ20_U are missing and PESQ1 missing then PESQ1 = integer(median of non-missing (PESQ1_U- PESQ8_U, PESQ10_U-PESQ14_U, PESQ16_U-PESQ20_U))
Notes: 1 = Never; 2 = Once or Twice; 3 = Sometimes; 4 = Often

ElementDescription: Question 2. In the past three months, how often have you used alcohol or other drugs at places on the street where adults hang around? (Imputed Version). Imputation Rule: if less than 4 of PESQ1_U-PESQ8_U, PESQ10_U- PESQ14_U, PESQ16_U-PESQ20_U are missing and PESQ2 missing then PESQ2 = integer(median of non-missing (PESQ1_U- PESQ8_U, PESQ10_U-PESQ14_U, PESQ16_U-PESQ20_U))
Notes: 1 = Never; 2 = Once or Twice; 3 = Sometimes; 4 = Often

ElementDescription: Problem Severity Scale using imputed values. Items included in score: PESQ1, PESQ2, PESQ3, PESQ4, PESQ5, PESQ6, PESQ7, PESQ8, PESQ10, PESQ11, PESQ12, PESQ13, PESQ14, PESQ16, PESQ17, PESQ18, PESQ19, PESQ20
Infrequency Scale. Measure of the tendency to "fake bad"
Notes: Items included in score: PESQ9, PESQ15, PESQ21

ElementDescription: Green/Red Problem Severity Scale Flag using imputed values.
Notes: G = Green flag; R = Red flag

ElementDescription: Green/Red Infrequency Scale Flag
Notes: G = Green flag; R = Red flag;

ElementDescription: PESQA 1. Mellow, calm, happy. In the past three months, how often have you used alcohol or other drug to feel mellow, calm, or happy?

Notes: 1 = Never; 2 = Once or Twice; 3 = Sometimes; 4 = Often

Notes: 1 = Never; 2 = Once or Twice; 3 = Sometimes; 4 = Often

ElementDescription: PESQA 9. Angry or irritated (i). In the past three months, how often have you used alcohol or drugs when you were angry or irritated? (imputed version)
Notes: 1 = Never; 2 = Once or Twice; 3 = Sometimes; 4 = Often

ElementDescription: PESQA 10. Time off (i). In the past three months, how often have you used alcohol or drugs on weekends, holidays, or days off? (imputed version)
Notes: 1 = Never; 2 = Once or Twice; 3 = Sometimes; 4 = Often

ElementDescription: PESQA 11. Whole day (i). In the past three months, how often have you used alcohol or drugs throughout the whole day? (imputed version)
Notes: 1 = Never; 2 = Once or Twice; 3 = Sometimes; 4 = Often

ElementDescription: PESQA 12. Lonely (i). In the past three months, how often have you used alcohol or drugs when you were lonely? (imputed version)
Notes: 1 = Never; 2 = Once or Twice; 3 = Sometimes; 4 = Often

ElementDescription: PESQA 13. Before or at work (i). In the past three months, how often have you used alcohol or drugs before or at work? (imputed version)
Notes: 1 = Never; 2 = Once or Twice; 3 = Sometimes; 4 = Often

ElementDescription: PESQA 14. Sad or depressed (i). In the past three months, how often have you been upset about other people talking about your using or drinking (imputed version)
Notes: 1 = Never; 2 = Once or Twice; 3 = Sometimes; 4 = Often

ElementDescription: PESQA 15. Family or work (i). In the past three months, how often have you avoided family activities or work responsibilities so you could get high? (imputed version)
Notes: 1 = Never; 2 = Once or Twice; 3 = Sometimes; 4 = Often

ElementDescription: PESQA 16. Think about something else (i). In the past three months, how often have you had thoughts of using or drinking when you should have been thinking of something else? (imputed version)
Notes: 1 = Never; 2 = Once or Twice; 3 = Sometimes; 4 = Often

ElementDescription: PESQA 17. Avoided friends (i). In the past three months, how often have you avoided friends so you could use alcohol or drugs? (imputed version)
Notes: 1 = Never; 2 = Once or Twice; 3 = Sometimes; 4 = Often

ElementDescription: PESQA 18. Kept on using (i).  In the past three months, how often have you kept on using drugs or drinking when you should have stopped? (imputed version)
Notes: 1 = Never; 2 = Once or Twice; 3 = Sometimes; 4 = Often

ElementDescription: PESQA 19. Multiple drugs at same time (i). In the past three months, how often have you used more than one drug at a same time in order to get high? (imputed version)
Notes: 1 = Never; 2 = Once or Twice; 3 = Sometimes; 4 = Often

ElementDescription: PESQA 20. Party friends (i). In the past three months, how often have you looked for people at parties with whom to get high? (imputed version)
Notes: 1 = Never; 2 = Once or Twice; 3 = Sometimes; 4 = Often

ElementDescription: PESQA 21. Excuses and lies (i). In the past three months, how often have you made excuses or lied to people about having drugs to make sure you would have enough for yourself? (imputed version)
Notes: 1 = Never; 2 = Once or Twice; 3 = Sometimes; 4 = Often

ElementDescription: PESQA 22. Cancelled plans (i). In the past three months, how often have you made plans to be with friends and then cancelled them so you could get drunk or high? (imputed version)
Notes: 1 = Never; 2 = Once or Twice; 3 = Sometimes; 4 = Often

ElementDescription: PESQA 23. Gone with things (i). In the past three months, to get or pay for alcohol or other drugs, how often have you gone without things you wanted or needed? (imputed version)
Notes: 1 = Never; 2 = Once or Twice; 3 = Sometimes; 4 = Often

ElementDescription: PESQA 24. Conned or used others (i). In the past three months, to get or pay for alcohol or other drugs, how often have you conned or used people? (imputed version)
Notes: 1 = Never; 2 = Once or Twice; 3 = Sometimes; 4 = Often

ElementDescription: PESQA 25. Changed other plans (i). In the past three months, to get or pay for alcohol or other drugs, how often have you changed other plans you had made? (imputed version)
Notes: 1 = Never; 2 = Once or Twice; 3 = Sometimes; 4 = Often

ElementDescription: Months from Time 0 to assessment
Months from SOFTAD enrollment date to assessment
Adolescent age: 19-year criterion
Notes: 0 = Under 19.0; 1 = 19.0 or older

ElementDescription: version/name of assessment
PESQ: correct form administered
Notes: 0 = No; 1 = Yes

ElementDescription: Visit name
Problem Severity Scale using imputed values (25 items)
Notes: PROBSEVA = PESQA1 + PESQA2 + PESQA3 + PESQA4 +PESQA5 + PESQA6 + PESQA7 + PESQA8 + PESQA9 +PESQA10 + PESQA11 + PESQA12 + PESQA13 + PESQA14 +PESQA15+ PESQA16 + PESQA17 + PESQA18 + PESQA19 +PESQA20 +PESQA21 + PESQA22 + PESQA23 + PESQA24 +PESQA25
